intro: Astragalus owyheensis, commonly known as the Owens Valley milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow pea-like flowers. This perennial plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and gravelly soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
